description: The fourleaf milkweed (Asclepias quadrifolia) is an amazing plant species that can be grown as an annual or perennial depending on the region. It is an attractive flowering plant with clusters of white to pinkish-purple blooms that are surrounded by four lance-shaped leaves. It is renowned as a host plant to the endangered Monarch butterfly, providing vital nectar and shelter. The seeds of the milkweed are also highly nutritious, making it a valuable food source for wildlife, while its robust taproot can help to break up soils and improve drainage in gardens. Fourleaf milkweed is sure to bring vibrancy and contrast to any garden!
